args: At long last, I've found a clue to locating\nthe fabled frozen city: the location of the\nlegendary Icebound Chalice!
Adventurer in Search of the Frozen City\nPietro
If I can find the chalice, I'll be able to\nprove the existence of the frozen city!\n...Er, most likely. I think.
Do I smell the sweet scent of a treasure\nhunt? You absolutely HAVE TO let me into\nthe mix on this little adventure!
Where there is treasure, there is Marty.\nI never let a chance for a prize slip away,\nbecause treasure makes folks happy!
Right! So. Now that THAT'S established,\nwhere is this treasure of yours?
If the cipher in Agatto's memoir is true,\nit's deep within Yuchen Cave.

Wait, Agatto's memoir? As in a document
penned by the legendary master of tricks
and traps? The baron of bamboozlement?
The dean of deception? THAT Agatto?
Also Yuchen Cave is a marvel of mysteries\nrumored to be filled to the brim with\nhidden treasures. How delightful!
Yes, and it's ALSO said to be overflowing\nwith tricks and traps of all stripes.
Danger is all part of the hunt—and as the\ngreatest and best in my field, there's one\nthing I know well:
A dead man can't enjoy his treasure!\nSo I'm coming with you, but we'll be sure\nto run if things get too spicy.
In that case, the Icebound Chalice\nis yours once we find it.
I only need it for the clue it contains about\nthe frozen city. After that, you should go\nahead and display it in your museum.
Everyone loves the place, after all,\nso let's give them something new\nand exciting to look at.
You're too kind. And now, let's head out\nand secure that chalice...FOR ADVENTURE!
The chalice should be somewhere in this\ncave. I wonder what secrets it holds...?
I imagine it will have some kind of code\nor cipher on it. Or maybe you'll see a map\nif you hold it up to the light!

If that's the case, I'll have to adjust how
I display it in the museum. ...Oh, and I'll
need you to write up a little something
for the description, too.
Like, ＂I TOLD you the frozen city is real＂?\nNo problem. Now let's go!

Er, but that being said, this cave looks
to be VERY confusing! We'd better mark
our way with chalk or breadcrumbs or...
Wait, not breadcrumbs. Birds'll eat 'em.
Shh! Did you just hear something?
What kind of something?\nA scary something?
Liiiike the sound of a rolling boulder?
Oh, come on! There's no WAY something \nas cliché as a rolling boulder would ever—
IT'S A HUGE ROLLING BOULDER!\nLIKE, FOR REAL!
*pant* *pant* Well, THAT was terrible.\nGuess those stories of tricks and traps\nweren't made up after all.
This place might be more dangerous than\nwe thought. Maybe we ought to consider\nhow nice it is to be alive and leave.
That's a nice thought, but I'm not entirely\nsure we have that option.

The air inside the cave and the varieties
of plants that grow here have changed,
which means we ended up deeper inside
while we were busy running away.
And I forgot to mark our path! ...You know,\nwith the boulder and the panicking and all.\nBut now we'll never find our way out!
Also, even if we DO head back the way we\ncame, there's still the boulder to deal with.\nOur best bet is probably to head deeper.

Hey, good idea! The memoir said
something about an exit being right
next to the chalice, so that'll be
real convenient.
Well, that's one piece of good news.\nAnd here's a second: the TRAPS!
Beeee...caaaaause...having traps here\nmeans there's something worth guarding?!
Bingo! Meaning all we have to do now\nis get our hands on said well-guarded\ntreasure, which is gonna be easy-peas—
Say, Marty? If you don't mind me picking\nyour brain for a quick sec, what was that\nsound just now?
Why, it was the sound of a trap-activation\nswitch! ...Oh, right. GET DOOOOOOWN!
And here we have yet another cliché.\nLooks like our only option is to charge\nboldly through these arrows.
Well, I got us into this mess,\nso I'm gonna get us out of it...
We're protected from the arrows\nfor a short time! Go, go, gooooo!
All right, we cleared the arrows.\nNow we're safe as... Wait, water?!
A river trap? In a cave? Diabolical!\nWe've got to think of a way to get across...
Oh no. Another giant boulder! Ruuuuun!
A swiftly moving stream in front of us,\nand a deadly boulder rolling behind us.\nLooks like this is the end for... Oh!
I've got an idea, Pietro! Here!\nTake my hand and DON'T let go!

As the world's greatest treasure hunter,
I WILL get us out of this predicament.
Instead of letting the boulder pancake us,
we'll use it to make our escape!
If we can manage to get on top of it and\nthen use it to get over the stream of water,\nwe'll be home free! ...Relatively.

If you use the barrier you showed me
earlier and combine it with my own,
we should juuust be able to offset the
boulder's force and clamber on top of it.

Yes—and even better, we're not in danger
from the boulder anymore! It was an
eleventh-hour idea, but I guess that's
just how you and me roll, Pietro.
Who knew an adventurer and a treasure\nhunter would be so compatible?
Yeah, we're peanut butter and jam all... \nPietro, look over there! A treasure chest!
Oh man, it's pretty beat up.\nShould we open it?
At last, I'm going to have a clue\nto finding the frozen city...
It's a chalice all right—but it's rusty.\nEr, and not frozen, either.
Looks like it would be a nice little item\nif you polished it up, but certainly not\nsomething I'd call ＂icebound.＂
So I'm not going to tell you not to feel\ndown about this, but...
Down? Heck no! This just means we'll\nhave to go on ANOTHER adventure!
Wow. You're very quick to move on.

Well, I'm pretty used to not finding clues.
Plus, if it means I get to go on adventures
with you, this could happen a hundred
times and I still wouldn't be upset!
Yeah! I mean, you're used to adventuring\nand super reliable—but most importantly,\nthis little trip was REALLY fun!
It was like the adventures I dreamed\nabout during my sickly childhood...
That's why I want us to go on more\nadventures together! Er, If you don't mind,\nthat is. Sooo...what do you think?
Are you kidding? I'll never turn down a\nrequest from a fellow adventure buff!
